TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit SourceChangedEventArgs extends System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs
Public NotInheritable Class SourceChangedEventArgs Inherits RoutedEventArgs
public ref class SourceChangedEventArgs sealed : System::Windows::RoutedEventArgs

Docs.summary: Provides data for the SourceChanged event, used for interoperation. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The SourceChanged event is a routed event where the event identifier is not publicly exposed. This is because this event plays a potentially critical part in interoperation and should not be allowed to be raised arbitrarily by any other source than the internal implementation of a known <xref:System.Windows.PresentationSource> subclass (currently, the only such class is <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource>). When implementing an interoperation solution, you can attach or remove handlers for the event (by calling <xref:System.Windows.PresentationSource.AddSourceChangedHandler%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.PresentationSource.RemoveSourceChangedHandler%2A>, respectively) but you cannot perform other operations normally available to routed events such as class handling, adding owners, or raising the event from an arbitrary element source.
This class overrides the <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs> virtual method <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.InvokeEventHandler%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>, in order to return a type-specific handler when requested by the event system. This <xref:System.Windows.SourceChangedEventArgs> override does not appear in the class members table in this [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_sdk](~/includes/tla2sharptla-sdk-md.md)] documentation because it is a protected member implemented by a sealed class.
